str2: A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.
